dt: {bc}a reception held by a person of distinction on rising from bed
{bc}an afternoon assembly at which the British sovereign or his or her representative receives only men
{bc}a reception usually in honor of a particular person

dt.t: the years of {wi}levees{/wi} and parades and other suave peacetime occasions

et: French {it}lever{/it}, from Middle French, act of arising, from ({it}se{/it}) {it}lever{/it} to rise
shortdef: a reception held by a person of distinction on rising from bed
an afternoon assembly at which the British sovereign or his or her representative receives only men
a reception usually in honor of a particular person

dt: {bc}a continuous dike or ridge (as of earth) for confining the irrigation areas of land to be flooded

et: French {it}levée{/it}, from Old French, act of raising, from {it}lever{/it} to raise {ma}{mat|lever|}{/ma}
shortdef: a continuous dike or ridge (as of earth) for confining the irrigation areas of land to be flooded
